file_content.text: Please hurry! Save my master!
The Sith gave me this to deliver to you, General Korvan.
Greetings, General.
Lord Magras. I suppose it was only a matter of time before the Sith became involved in this war.
You must be the riffraff I've heard so much about.
And you must be the little Jedi who's been helping them. Aren't you just precious?
And you must be the grunt I've been hearing about. It's uplifting to see someone so limited achieve even marginal success.
And what have we here? A grubby space rat? Korvan, I had no idea you kept pets.
Oh, look at this! You must be Korvan's new little helper. Isn't that charming?
Is this really the best you could find, Korvan? You have my deepest condolences.
Tell us what you've done with Broga and Treeg.
Where are our allies?
Quiet down. The grown-ups are talking now.
That's enough from you.
You want to chat, talk to my blaster carbine.
Yeah, keep talking, pal.
So temperamental! Do you know where your little friends are?
Do I look sad? Try again, buddy.
You're just dumb.
What do you want?
It is with great sorrow that I must inform you of the defection of your valued servant and war hero, Major Treeg.
You are standing in the midst of his handiwork. He killed his own soldiers to deliver Broga to me.
What have you done with my master?
The Hutt is with me, in your former venom mine. Another gift from Major Treeg.
Let me talk to Broga. Or Treeg.
I want proof Broga's alive.
This is not a hostage negotiation. I don't care in the slightest if you believe me.
I'm sure you aren't giving us this information for our benefit.
Why are you telling us this?
I am issuing an invitation.
I'm not listening to any more.
Have I upset you? A thousand pardons.
Would you like these things back? Come to the mine and take them. My door is always open.
This is my fault. I should have seen it coming.
We need a plan to strike back.
What can we do?
You think that Sith was telling the truth? Treeg could be a prisoner, too.
Do you believe Treeg defected?
That would make the situation no less dire.
I'm going after Treeg.
As it stands, Quesh is lost. There's little time to regain control before Republic Command orders us off the planet.
We must stop Lord Magras. And if the major has turned against us... bring him to justice.
That mine can only be a trap.
I sense this won't be easy.
If Treeg betrayed the Republic, Havoc Squad will teach him about remorse.
I want a piece of Treeg.
Be careful, Captain. I am relying upon your discretion and judgment in this matter.
I mean, calling us to gloat and inviting us to stop him? That's practically villain textbook.
You do know this is a trap?
It's almost certainly a trap. And we haven't much choice but to walk into it.
Might as well send everyone we've got. There's nothing left to defend, anyway.
Why not send the army?
I can't send men to capture their own commanding officer. If word gets out... it would cause chaos in the ranks.
I can handle this.
All our hopes rest on you now. Find Lord Magras and Major Treeg. Put a stop to this. Save Broga if you can.
I'll return to base to await your report. Good luck.
I am in your debt. I don't know what they would have done to me, if you had not intervened.
My word... I expected trouble when I lost contact with Broga and Major Treeg, but I never imagined this....
